alert.note: Alert for Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 4:23PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of New Hanover, southern Pender and northeastern Brunswick Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 422 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rocky Point to near Leland. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Leland, Hampstead, Bishop, Hightsville, Wilmington International Airport, Murrayville, Castle Hayne, University Of North Carolina At Wilmington, Scotts Hill, Ogden, Wrightsboro, Topsail, Windemere, Bayshore, Porters Neck, and Kings Grant. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 409 and 416. Interstate 140 US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 39 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal New Hanover; Coastal Pender; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender
